title: More efficient logic is expected to process disk sorting when there is a border value for row value
OB: When sorting on disk, if sorting 40000 rows of data and the program is set to process the data less than 40000, the program does not handle the border value correctly.
EB: The program should handle the border value correctly when sorting on disk.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Generate 40000 rows of data. 
2. Set the program to process only 30000 rows. 
3. Sort the data on disk. 
4. Observe how the program handles the border value when sorting.
